A good selection of small restaurants, shops, bakery‚Äôs etc.
There is a MUJI, and MUJI cafe. Don Fon Donki, Daiso, FairPrice Finest, beautitians etc.
It‚Äôs a mall you go to eat for, not really a mall you wanna walk around at. It‚Äôs not very charming..
MUJI has a good selection of everything. Daiso has a lot of small good to have stuff. Don Don Donki is big, and great for snacks, fruit, socks, beauty products. Well they have a little of everything.

üüß 100 AM mall is a medium-sized mall featuring four levels of retail stores, lifestyle shops, restaurants & eateries.

‚úÖÔ∏èüåø It also has a Daiso and a popular Don Donki store there. ‚óè Don Don Donki takes up 2 levels of retail space.

‚û°Ô∏è This 100AM mall is conveniently located within a few minutes' walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT station.

üî∑Ô∏è I have been to this mall several times over the years when my husband was working around that area. üü® This mall has many Japanese eateries &  Êó•Êú¨ stores and is said to be a "Little Japan" in Singapore.
What a wonderful fresh brew tea drinking corner I came across here, and surprisingly, the price is just $5 for such a huge tall cup for high-quality  tea I ever had.

Lots of new F&B. Famous River South Prawn Noodle is now opened here. The Japanese food street has been great. Always clean albeit crowded during lunch time. But the F&B mix is good. Muji and DDK are there as well. Too bad there‚Äôs no sheltered walkway from the MRT station.

I enjoy this mall very much. It has two supermarkets with very different varieties, great coffee shops, and a selection of extremely good, authentic and reasonably priced(for the standard) Japanese cuisine. Also, not a cookie cutter mall in Singapore. One of my favorite malls.
